name: Institute of Chartered Accountants in England and Wales
goal: ICAEW operates under a Royal Charter, working in the public interest. Its regulation of its members, in particular its responsibilities in respect of auditors, is overseen by the UK Financial Reporting Council. As a world leading professional accountancy body, ICAEW provides leadership and practical support to over 149,000 members around the world, working with governments, regulators and industry to ensure the highest standards are maintained. Our members provide financial knowledge and guidance based on the highest technical and ethical standards. We develop and support individuals, organisations and communities to help them achieve long-term, sustainable economic value.
interests: Banking and financial services, Budget, Business and Industry, Consumers, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, General and Institutional Affairs, Single market, Taxation, Trade
euInitiatives: - Financial reporting & accounting, including IFRS endorsement - Capital Markets Union - Tax policy, including issues related to the role of intermediaries -Public sector finances, including measures relating to public sector accounting standards (IPSAS/EPSAS) - Audit policy, including implementation of Audit Regulation and Audit Directive - Single Market issues, including actions from the Commission Single Market Strategy - Brexit negotiations. As well as developments in the financial services / corporate governance / company law / digital policy / sustainability / enterprise / professional requirements & skills areas.
